intro: Bidens coronata var. brachyodonta, commonly known as the short-rayed tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant features slender, branching stems and is typically found in moist, open habitats such as prairies and wetlands. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow with white rays. This variety is distinguished by its shorter rays compared to the typical form of Bidens coronata.
